cinnamon.engine.object

Interface Mesh

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ImmutableMesh, TransformableMesh

    public interface Mesh

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Point getCentroid()
      Gets the centroid of all vertices.
      int getIndex(int i)
      Gets the index at the given vertex index.

      Copies all vertex indices into the given array starting at the specified offset into the array.

      Copies all vertex indices into the given buffer.

      Gets the mesh's name.

      Gets the texture coordinate at the given index.

      Copies all texture coordinates into the given array starting at the specified offset into the array.

      Copies all texture coordinates into the given buffer.

      Gets the number of components per vertex.

      Gets the number of vertices.

      Copies all vertices into the given array starting at the specified offset into the array.
      FloatBuffer getVertices(FloatBuffer vertices)
      Copies all vertices into the given buffer.
      boolean is2D()
      Checks if vertices only have two components (x,y).

    • Method Detail

      • getCentroid

        Point getCentroid()

        Gets the centroid of all vertices.

        Returns:
        centroid.

      • getIndex

        int getIndex(int i)

        Gets the index at the given vertex index.

        Parameters:
        i - vertex index.
        Returns:
        index.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if i < 0 or i >= vertex count.

      • getIndices

        int[] getIndices(int[] indices,
                 int offset)

        Copies all vertex indices into the given array starting at the specified offset into the array.

        Parameters:
        indices - destination.
        offset - into destination.
        Returns:
        destination.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if indices is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if there is not enough space between the specified offset and the end of the given array to copy all vertex indices.

      • getIndices

        IntBuffer getIndices(IntBuffer indices)

        Copies all vertex indices into the given buffer.

        Parameters:
        indices - buffer.
        Returns:
        buffer.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if indices is null.

      • getName

        String getName()

        Gets the mesh's name.

        Returns:
        name.

      • getTextureCoordinate

        Point getTextureCoordinate(int i,
                           Point textureCoordinate)

        Gets the texture coordinate at the given index.

        Parameters:
        i - index.
        textureCoordinate - container.
        Returns:
        container.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if i < 0 or i >= vertex count.
        NullPointerException - if textureCoordinate is null.

      • getTextureCoordinates

        float[] getTextureCoordinates(float[] coordinates,
                              int offset)

        Copies all texture coordinates into the given array starting at the specified offset into the array.

        Parameters:
        coordinates - destination.
        offset - into destination.
        Returns:
        destination.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if coordinates is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if there is not enough space between the specified offset and the end of the given array to copy all texture coordinates.

      • getVertex

        Point getVertex(int i,
                Point vertex)

        Gets the vertex at the given index.

        Parameters:
        i - index.
        vertex - container.
        Returns:
        container.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if i < 0 or i >= vertex count.
        NullPointerException - if vertex is null.

      • getVertexComponentCount

        default int getVertexComponentCount()

        Gets the number of components per vertex.

        Returns:
        2 if is2D() is true, 3 otherwise.

      • getVertexCount

        int getVertexCount()

        Gets the number of vertices.

        Returns:
        number of vertices.

      • getVertices

        float[] getVertices(float[] vertices,
                    int offset)

        Copies all vertices into the given array starting at the specified offset into the array.

        Parameters:
        vertices - destination.
        offset - into destination.
        Returns:
        destination.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if vertices is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if there is not enough space between the specified offset and the end of the given array to copy all vertices.

      • getVertices

        FloatBuffer getVertices(FloatBuffer vertices)

        Copies all vertices into the given buffer.

        Parameters:
        vertices - buffer.
        Returns:
        buffer.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if vertices is null.

      • is2D

        boolean is2D()

        Checks if vertices only have two components (x,y).

        Returns:
        false if vertices have three components (x,y,z).
